definition: to climb (by pulling oneself up)/to implicate/to claim connections of higher status
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss

sentences.english: C. I'm usually the first person to strike up a conversation with strangers.
sentences.chinese: 我通常是最先與陌生人攀談的人。

sentences.english: They conversed with the familiarity of a long-established acquaintance.
sentences.chinese: 他們儼然如老相識一樣親密無間地攀談了。

sentences.english: He introduced himself to Comrade Wang, hoping to enter into conversation with him.
sentences.chinese: 他向王同志作了自我介紹，想同他攀談。

sentences.english: I had been waiting there some little time, when I was accosted by a stranger.
sentences.chinese: 我在那裏等了好一會兒，後來有一位陌生人同我攀談。

sentences.english: In the dancing party,a young girl latched onto the millionaire.
sentences.chinese: 在舞會上，一個姑娘主動和那個百萬富翁攀談起來。

sentences.english: A week after the tsunami, once again I went to talk to the sea.
sentences.chinese: 海嘯發生一個星期後，我再次來到了海邊，跟她攀談。

sentences.english: He finds it hard to mix at parties.
sentences.chinese: 他感到很難在聚會上與人攀談。

sentences.english: I spun around in my swivel chair and chatted with Jim.
sentences.chinese: 我坐在旋轉椅上，扭過身，和吉姆攀談了起來。

sentences.english: They hoped this expertise might help improve their chat-up technique.
sentences.chinese: 他們希望這種專家能幫忙改善自己攀談的技巧。
